text: Khomo tsa tala li lahla balisa
meaning: Ha motho a fumane monono, a ka qetella a se a sa tsotelle le ba mothusitseng ho fihla moo.
translation: Sometimes when a person is experiencing a joyous life or moment, they turn to forget those who helped them reach that state.

text: Khomo boela haeno u holile
meaning: Ke maele a sebelisoang ha motho a bile sebakeng se eseng habo, joale ha lilemo li mo lumella o lokela ho khutlela habo.
translation: One has to return to their place of origin when sufficiently grown or when their purpose in the current place is over.

text: Khomo ke molimo o nko e metsi
meaning: Melemo ea khomo bophelong ba Basotho ha e na ho lekanyoa.
translation: Cattle are regarded as the most significant animals among Basotho due to their cultural and practical roles, thus compared to God’s importance.

text: Ke khomo ea senona le tlhako
meaning: Ke ha motho a na le maruo kapa a fana ka nkatana.
translation: It refers to a wealthy or rich person.

text: Likhomo ke lisala li eme
meaning: Ha motho a e-na le maruo, o lula a bonahala ka tsona.
translation: Wealth (like cattle) always stands out and is visible.

text: O jele khomo ea molatelle
meaning: Ke ha motho a latella ntho esita leha ho se sa hlokahala.
translation: When someone persists in following something even when it’s no longer necessary.

text: Ntoa ke khomo’a khameloa-meutloeng
meaning: Ho tsoela pele le ha motho a le maemong a boima haholo bophelong.
translation: When a person is experiencing the greatest difficulties in life but still continues the journey.

text: Khomo ha li na motloapele
meaning: Katleho ea motho e tla fihla ka nako ea hae.
translation: Everyone’s success will come at its appointed time.

text: Li jana maro ntja tsa setsumi
meaning: Ke ha bana ba motho ba loant’sana.
translation: It is when children of the same father fight among themselves.

text: Ha u otla ntja e tla u betlela meno
meaning: Ha u sotla motho kapa phoofolo, o ka qetella a boela ho u hlasela.
translation: If you constantly mistreat a person or animal, they might retaliate one day.

text: Ke ntja seloma mokhoki
meaning: Ho thusa motho ebe ha a qeta ho u fetohela.
translation: Helping someone only for them to turn against you.

text: Ke ntja ea se t’soarisa mohlophe
meaning: Ke ha motho a bonahala eka o molemo empa a le kotsi.
translation: A person who appears harmless but is actually dangerous.

text: Tau tsa hlaka le le leng lia tsebana
meaning: Ba matla kapa ba tšoanang ba a tsebana.
translation: Strong or similar people recognize each other.

text: Basali ke tau li mesana
meaning: Basali ba ka tsoha ba ba le matla kapa sebete se seholo.
translation: Women can show great strength or bravery.

text: Tau ha li hlatsoane maro
meaning: Batho ba matla ha ba tsoare lipuisano tse senyang.
translation: Strong people don’t waste time in petty quarrels.

text: Phokojoe ea mofutsana e fetoha tlakaro
meaning: Ha motho a futsanehile, o tšoaroa joalo ka papali ke ba bang.
translation: When a person is poor, others treat them like a toy.

text: Phokojoe ea t’salla morao e bonoa ke lintja
meaning: Ha motho a sa potlake, ba bang ba tla mo hlōla kapa ba mo utloe.
translation: If one lags behind, others will catch up and expose them.

text: Phokojoe ho phela e liretsana
meaning: Bophelo ba futsanehi bo tšoana le ho phela ka ho tšehetsoa ke ba bang.
translation: The life of a poor person depends on others’ leftovers.

text: Phokojoe e lahliloe ke mongobo
meaning: Ha motho a lahletsoe ke lintho tsa bohlokoa, a sala a se na thuso.
translation: When someone loses essential support, they become helpless.

text: Khomo tsa tala li lahla balisa
meaning: Kamehla ha monono u le teng motho ha tsotelle ba mo alositseng
translation: When there's wealth, one sometimes turns to turn a blind eye to the ones who actually uplifted them to such greatest height.
